intro: Reaumuria hirtella var. palaestina, commonly known as the Palestine sea buckthorn, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green leaves and clusters of orange-red berries that mature in late summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, including high salinity and drought. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
